issue.title: [Python] Run s3fs unit tests in Travis CI
issue.body:
***Note**: This issue was originally created as [ARROW-1456](https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/ARROW-1456). Please see the [migration documentation](https://gist.github.com/toddfarmer/12aa88361532d21902818a6044fda4c3) for further details.*

### Original Issue Description:
We'll need to set up an S3 bucket to write to with credentials that cannot compromise anyone's AWS account. I've been testing locally with a user that I set up but I wouldn't be comfortable checking in these credentials, even in encrypted form, without more scrutiny

comments.body:
***Note**: [Comment](https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/ARROW-1456?focusedCommentId=16151987) by Florian Jetter (fjetter):*
Mocking s3 may already be enough for the arrow unit tests. E.g. https://github.com/spulec/moto

***Note**: [Comment](https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/ARROW-1456?focusedCommentId=16152450) by Uwe Korn (uwe):*
Alternatively we could setup a small S3 server in Docker using https://github.com/minio/minio

***Note**: [Comment](https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/ARROW-1456?focusedCommentId=16942083) by Krisztian Szucs (kszucs):*
Resolved by https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/5423
